"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents mention various pathologies related to myocardial infarction. The first document highlights the pre-hospital phase problem, where 50% of deaths occur prior to hospital arrival due to potentially correctible arrhythmias. Another document discusses patients with hyperthyroidism and normal coronary arteries, suggesting that other factors contribute to myocardial infarction beyond just coronary artery disease. A third paper describes cases of congestive cardiomyopathy with electro- and vectorcardiographic signs of myocardial infarction but with patent coronary arteries, indicating the limitations of Q wave patterns on electrocardiograms in diagnosing myocardial infarction. The final document highlights autonomic neuropathy and painless myocardial infarction in diabetic patients, providing insight into the mechanisms underlying this condition.

Considering these findings, it appears that the major pathology driving myocardial infarction is not solely due to coronary artery disease or occlusion.",
